author: Corky Emrick
title: Bronson, Mendon earn BCS sweeps
text: Bronson, Mendon earn BCS sweeps Prep volleyball action sees Lady Vikes, Hornets go 2-0 Comment Posted Oct. 21, 2015 at 10:21 PM Both Mendon and Bronson showed their BCS dominance with wins over Berrien Springs and Comstock. The Lady Hornets beat the Shamrocks 25-10, 25-9, 25-15 and Comstock 25-10, 25-8, 25-9. “We’re working on our lineups, preparing for districts,” Mendon coach Bill Trenary said. “Our kids are playing well, we’re getting faster.” Kaley Smith led with 47 digs and added nine aces and two kills, Megann Leighton had 11 aces, 22 kills and six blocks and Cassie Plummer had 46 assists. Brandy DeLeeuw added 13 kills and two blocks, Emma Eberstein had 15 digs, six kills and three aces and Madison Weinberg had six blocks. Bronson also had no problems dispatching the Colts and Shamrocks. The Lady Vikings defeated Comstock 25-10, 25-7, 25-15 and Berrien Springs 25-14, 25-7, 25-10. “I thought we did a good job of continuing to play hard throughout the match,” Bronson coach Jean LaClair said. “We had a lot of players contribute in many ways, and worked out some of the struggles that we have been having.” Alexa Ratkowski had 58 assists, 11 digs, nine aces and six kills, Allie Sikorski had 12 kills, 15 digs and four aces and Jill Pyles had 12 kills, nine aces and one dig. Adyson Lasky had 12 digs, eight aces and one kill, Kiera Lasky had 23 digs, 13 aces and one kill, Kirin Cekander added 11 digs, seven kills and one ace and Kiana Mayer had four kills, three blocks, two assists, two digs and two aces. Asthon Wronikowski had six kills, Clare Mayes added four kills and one block, Jenna Smoker had one ace, two kills and three digs, Kelcy Sikorski had two assists and two digs and Kelsey Robinson added two digs.
